row.header: What's my experience of the class?
row.text: We start to dig into more the detailed implementation and unique points of Python as a language. It's quite fascinating to see the things that you can do so smoothly with Python. I enjoyed the lectures from past week a lot.

My pick-of-the-week is PyBuilder. Analogous to Apache Maven and Scala-SBT, PyBuilder is continuous build tool that allow you to manage dependencies, run scripts, unit tests and coverage, etc. Obviously, you can all accomplish this with just a simple makefile. However, I find it interesting to use a python library to handle this build part for a python project. I'm still learning more about it, and I like it a lot. Moreover, it's 100% open-source, so maybe you can even contribute?!?
